- Kim-chili Ramen mac: noodles too bloated. Mac and cheese flavor isn't great.
-Kim Bap: rice was really soggy. Only 5 pieces for $8!

The good ones:
- Beef rib is decent. Falling off bone tender. Got a nice smoke flavor to it. But only thing "Asian" about it is the soy sauce dipping sauce.
- Kim Chi Fries: can't go wrong with fries, kimchi, meat, and cheese.
- BAF wings: good flavors. Wing is tender. Good with beer. Not the crunchy type coating but still tasty.

Okay ones:
- Potato Swirl: looks pretty. A bit too thin and over fried for my personal preference
-

"Two years later, I came back... The Yuzu cocktail I love is now $18... Sad... Learned the reason the bartender from two years ago gave me so much trouble was because management charges the bartenders for miss orders and over pouring... More sad... Management bad"

Don't order mix drinks from here, if they accidentally use soda water instead of sprite and you request another one they will tell you "We are all trained to make drinks the same way, we can get you another drink but you will be changed for it". So yea they messed up my Yuzu drink and told me they didn't mess it up and they would not make me another one.

Did karaoke with friends and it was great! Every room was packed and the song selection was never ending.  The staff was fun and friendly and willing to help when needed, so that was nice!

Drinks are pricy but that's because they don't tips and the price is added directly with I like. So bring plenty of cash or be ready for the bill if you are buying or like to party.

Good is amazing and the chicken wings are great.

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte simply because of the Korean Chicken Wings! I wish they still did the $1 side days because some (most) of the sides aren't worth the money they charge. The side that is worth it is the Kimchi fries, even with the price increases, which we get every time. Cool, relaxing vibe and the outside area is sweet as well!
It's really a cool place to hang out. I enjoy myself. I want to go there again

You can rent private karaoke rooms at this place. A friend booked one for us and we had dinner. Karaoke selection was decent. The food was definitely good. Loved the tacos. I tried the "no refund spicy" tofu and it was legitimately spicy. If you like spicy food, you'll love it.
The portions are small, unlike the Korean restaurant I visited in South Africa. The place does not have the oriental Korean culture. See pictures from a Korean restaurant in South Africa.
Delicious and the bartender  as well as line staff that were bussing the tables were amazing.
Very nice servers... food was delicious,  fast service, had so much fun in karaoke room. Would definitely visit again when I go back to Charlotte

Disappointing.
The bathroom was out of toilet paper and soap.
The chairs are very uncomfortable, especially if you're a bigger person. You are told to pick your own seat and when you're ready to order you have to go to the bar to order, which when we there had a very long line of people ordering drinks and food. The food was eh.
We ordered wings, baked ram and cheese, chicken tacos, pork tacos, and the green tea ice cream biscuits (adding up to $60). The wings were good (and big) but they were too salty. The ram and cheese was flavorless and had a gritty uncooked flour feel. The pork and chicken tacos were also lacking flavor. the green tea ice cream had a very subtle flavor and was not sweet at all which paired nicely with the sugar coated biscuits it's served in.
Overall, the food was disappointing and i would not go back.

Would not ammend  taco, which they put too much cream on it, which made it inedible for my wife. I asked them to leave it off, and they said they do not modify orders, I spoke with MOD, and he said it was owners that made policy. If you have any food allergies like we did don't come here.  They would not refund the $7 , so food went in trash

Love this place got the giant rib and it stood up to it's name!! Very good indeed and the bar atmosphere is really nice only downfall is that it's pretty cold sit by the exits I recommend they winterize the seating area to keep drafts from coming in..

The brisket was incredible. Easily rivaled any southern BBQ brisket I've ever had. The beef fries were amazing and would be a delicious whole meal by themselves. The pimento cheese was super tasty too and the beer selection was decent enough to be happy with. Overall the whole food/bev experience was top notch! Would love to go back but I'm not a local unfortunately! Highly recommended.
Good food, temp on burner was off and burnt some food. Kind of annoying. Great service and unlimited food helped.
THEY DON'T CARE ABOUT YOU !! they don't care about customer satisfaction they just want your money.

As a business owner who cares about people, their customers and community...it saddens me to say Seoul Food DOES NOT CARE!

Two people got their cars towed during the weekday. Yes, after the fact, we saw signs but clearly they are not doing a good enough job at notifying their customers about this. They need to have each employee trained to really inform everyone verbally because it's easy to miss signs when your coming in after a long day of hard work to spend time with friends, eat food and enjoy yourself. They last thing anyone wants to do is look at signs, marketing material or whatever posted on walls. Those two people who had to spend almost $400 to get there cars back are honest people and not looking for trouble yet we can't control it according to Andrew the manager.

As a business...who sells their lot unless they are just there to take the communities money, don't care, or have some other internal problems that they need the money to do so. Perhaps the articles read elsewhere were right, things like the place isn't what it used to be, going downhill, etc.

We also spent a lot of money since there food prices are astronomically high. The place was dirty and things were broke in the karaoke room and bathroom. The customer service was cold and non existent. The employees were on their phones and we bad to call for them when we needed something. The owners don't seem to care at all because it seems that they must think that since they are in Southend that all is going to be ok due to shear numbers.

Well it will STOP now, I hope everyone can see this review and know that you should spend your hard earned money in a classier establishment. One that actually cares about you, the community and what their reputation stands for.

Terrible place, the food was average to BAD, place was dirty feeling and no warm vibes from staff at all. Food was very over priced and they should just get out of Southend because they are to old and CLEARLY don't care anymore about the community or their customers. No wonder they have been in articles and magazines saying bad things and how the company is going down at this location. Just don't waste your time, let them leave and then we can get a classier better caring business in there who cares about the community.

I would NOT recommend for several reasons. We as a group decide to go here on a Wednesday night to do Karaoke and food. The room was dirty, microphones didn't work, books dirty and room smelled. The food was average at best, the service was fine but slow.

Oh and they DONT own their lot...so my car got towed and cost me $300 dollars. So forget this place unless you want to be nickeled and dimed for average food, average atmosphere, and if you want your car towed!

Also you can't even tip your server or bartender unless it's cash...seems a little to sketchy for me to ever go back. Andrew was the manager/owner/ who ever working this night. He just said sorry and no help.
American Korean mix restaurant, not really down to earth but the atmosphere is good. Highly recommend pork belly.

This place has really gone down hill. The prices have doubled over the past year or so, and that's not inflation, it's price gouging. Meanwhile the service has become non-existent. It used to be great but now I wouldn't bother
Where to start? Such a great place to bring kids and meetup in a large group. Great service from Carly and team. Food was next level...coming from a foodie. Overall fantastic experience!
The food is not good.

Hate to give this place 3 stars. Seoul used to be good. We used to come here frequently and even did karaoke a few times. Came back yesterday and was disappointed not only by the food, but by the service.
Food: The soy garlic wings are a usual go to, but they were not as crispy or tasty yesterday. Also ordered the pork kimchi taco which was room temperature heat. The bulgogi kimbap was just okay too.
Service: when we ordered at the front bar, the lady was rude. We had a question about substitutions and her response was curt. When I went to close my tab there was an addition $40+ dollars on my tab of food I didn't order. They said it was because another person had a similar last name and the food ended up on my tab. Really should be more careful about that.
I want to say I would come back, but if the level of service continues to be rude and nonchalant to customers probably not. It shows because they weren't as crowded as other bars on a nice day in South End. Hope management can get this place back on track.
Good spot for karaoke. We enjoyed the private room, but the food was overpriced and not good. They also charge $20 non-refundable just to book a karaoke room.
Bad management run by entitled millennials who think cops solve all their problems.

This experience was not a pleasant one. Two of us ordered 6 wings, sweet and mild flavor. One patron's wing came out cold and she switched for a taco instead. I attempted to eat my wings, but they were covered in sauce and heavily breaded. I informed the waitress that I am unable to eat these due to the amount of sauce and requested to switch to another flavor, which several others were eating and indicated they were decent. They did not have a ton of sauce on them. She told me I could not switch and if I did, I would have to pay for the old and new order of wings. My friends asked what the difference was with the other switched order. She indicated that "something has to be wrong. My order is not wrong, I just don't like them."  I was forced to pay $14 for food I did not eat.I confirmed with another employee and he said they asked the manager and that was his response. What's interesting is I received the answer from her without speaking to the manager. Never will this restaurant get my business again.
